class.name: Magikoopa
equipment: (a) a scholar’s pack or (b) an entertainer’s pack

entries.name: Class Summary
entries: Magikoopas — chaotic magi of misrule — are reality warpers who blend arcane precision with joyful unpredictability. They twist magic into whimsical effects: summoning shell-clad minions, warping space with laughter, and rewriting luck itself.

entries.name: Hit Points
entries: Hit Dice: 1d6 per Magikoopa level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per Magikoopa level after 1st

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries: You are a full caster following the same progression as a wizard. You prepare and cast spells using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability.
Spell Save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell Attack Modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Your magic is whimsical and unpredictable. When you cast certain Magikoopa spells or class features, you may roll a Chaos Die (d4–d12) to determine a random effect.

entries.name: Chaotic Casting (Level 1)
entries: Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, roll a d4:
1 – You gain temporary flight (10 ft hover) until the end of your next turn.
2 – You sparkle with magic; gain +2 AC until your next turn.
3 – You cackle maniacally; your spell attack rolls gain +1 until the end of your turn.
4 – Your magic ricochets; you may move 10 ft without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Trickster’s Step (Level 1)
entries: As a Bonus Action, teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see, leaving behind a brief illusion of yourself.
Uses = Intelligence modifier + Proficiency bonus (min 1); regained after a long rest.

entries.name: Arcane Tinkering (Level 2)
entries: As a bonus action, you can infuse a minor spell into a trinket or object you touch. Choose a cantrip you know; until the start of your next turn, that object hums with faint power. When a creature touches it, it casts the cantrip as if you had.
Once you use this, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Alternatively, cause an object to emit light, sound, or a harmless illusion for 1 minute.

entries.name: School of Misrule (Level 3)
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a School of Misrule that reflects your magical philosophy:
Grand Advisor — master of destiny and manipulation.
Arcane Prankster — chaotic illusionist who toys with foes.
Reality Shaper — manipulator of the fabric of existence.
Your choice grants features at 3rd, 6th, 10th, and 14th levels.

entries.name: Spell Inflection (Level 5)
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, roll a d6 to add an unpredictable effect:
1 — The spell’s damage becomes force damage.
2 — The spell deals +1d8 bonus damage.
3 — You regain HP equal to half your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).
4 — The spell’s range doubles.
5 — Targets have disadvantage on their next saving throw.
6 — You gain +2 AC until the start of your next turn.
Uses = Intelligence modifier per long rest.

entries.name: Broom Mastery (Level 7)
entries: You can summon or dismiss your Arcane Broom as a Bonus Action. While mounted, your flying speed equals your walking speed.
Whenever you cast a spell while flying, you may shift 10 feet in any direction as part of the same action.

entries.name: Guided Mayhem (Level 9)
entries: Whenever you roll a Chaos Die, roll an additional die and choose either result. If you roll the same number, reroll until different.
Once per long rest, you may choose any Chaos Die result without rolling.
At 18th level, you may do this twice per long rest.

entries.name: Reality Slip (Level 11)
entries: As a Bonus Action, become incorporeal until end of your next turn. You can move through creatures and objects as difficult terrain, taking 1d10 force damage if you end inside one.
Uses = Proficiency bonus per long rest.

entries.name: Arcane Surge (Level 13)
entries: As a Bonus Action, supercharge your next spell. Roll a d8:
1 – Targets save with disadvantage.
2 – Damage dice become d10s.
3 – You regain 3 × spell level HP.
4 – Spell doesn’t require concentration.
5 – Affects one additional target.
6 – Ignores resistance.
7 – Teleport 20 ft before/after casting.
8 – Gain an extra Bonus Action next turn.
Uses = 2 per long rest.

entries.name: Reality Blink (Level 15)
entries: When targeted by an attack or harmful spell, you can use your Reaction to vanish, reappearing within 30 ft in an unoccupied space; the attack automatically misses.
Uses = Intelligence modifier per long rest (regain half on short rest).

entries.name: Arcane Cataclysm (Level 17)
entries: Once per long rest as an Action, unleash catastrophic magic. Each creature of your choice within 60 ft must make a Dexterity save vs your Spell Save DC. On fail: 12d10 force damage + push 20 ft. Success: half damage, no push.
After use, roll d12 on the Lingering Effects Table to determine a random field of chaos for 1 minute (see source document).

entries.name: Master of Misrule (Level 20)
entries: You can choose any Chaos Die result without rolling. Once per turn when you cast a spell, you may also cast a cantrip as a Bonus Action.
Once per long rest, cast Rewrite Reality — reshape a 30-ft area of terrain or restore structures instantly.

entries.name: This Is How It’s Done (3rd Level)
entries: As a Free Action, when you or an ally within 30 ft makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you may declare: “This is how it’s done!”
Replace that die result with either a natural 1 or 20 (your choice).
Uses = Intelligence modifier (min 1) per long rest.

entries.name: Arcane Escapade (6th Level)
entries: When you or an ally within 30 ft takes damage or is targeted by an attack, you can use your Reaction for one of the following:
Slapstick Shift. Teleport the target 15 ft; attacker must succeed Int save or grant advantage on next attack against it.
Comedic Counter. Reduce damage by 1d8 + Int mod and attacker has disadvantage on next attack.
Chaotic Blessing. Target ally gains +1d8 to next attack roll or spell save DC.
Uses = higher of Int or Proficiency bonus per long rest.

entries.name: Script of Shenanigans (10th Level)
entries: Dimensional Double. When you use a Bonus Action to cast a cantrip or Kamek feature, your 'other you' acts in sync; as part of that Bonus Action, either make one weapon attack (using Int for attack and damage), command a summoned Koopa to attack, or heal an ally for 1d8.
Uses = Intelligence modifier per long rest.
Spell Weaving. You can maintain concentration on two spells at once if one is 2nd level or lower (for 1 minute maximum, then choose one to keep). Once per short rest.

entries.name: Grand Rewrite (14th Level)
entries: As an Action, choose up to three creatures within 30 ft; each rerolls one d20 rolled within the last round, and you decide which result applies. Once per long rest.

entries.name: Mirage Mastery (3rd Level)
entries: Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, create a 15-ft cube mirage within 60 ft lasting until your next turn.
Creatures entering or starting their turn there make a Wis save vs your DC or suffer one:
• Speed halved until next turn. • Disadvantage on next attack or save. • Teleport 5 ft in random direction (d8).
You can create Int modifier mirages per long rest. Bonus Action to move or reshape an active mirage when you cast.
Out of combat, you can create harmless illusions in a 10-ft cube for 10 minutes.

entries.name: Trickspace Shift (6th Level)
entries: When you take damage from an attack, use Reaction to teleport 15 ft and summon an illusory duplicate (1 mirror image).
When an ally within 30 ft takes damage, you can swap their position with another willing creature within 30 ft of them.
If damage < 30, attacker makes Int save or is disoriented (disadvantage on next attack).
Uses = Proficiency bonus per long rest.

entries.name: Prismatic Paradox (10th Level)
entries: Once per turn when you cast a spell of 2nd level or higher, apply one Paradox Effect:
• Twin Mirage – affect a second target for half effect.
• Quantum Dodge – you or an ally gains resistance to all damage until your next turn.
• Echo Cast – spell repeats at start of your next turn at half potency.
• Holographic Reality – duplicate yourself; advantage on next attack before end of turn.
Uses = Int modifier per long rest. At 14th level you may apply two different effects once per long rest.

entries.name: Grand Hall of Mirrors (14th Level)
entries: As an Action, create a 30-ft-radius sphere of mirrored reflections for 1 minute (no concentration).
Allies gain +1 AC and advantage on Dex saves; once per turn when you cast or attack, teleport 15 ft and leave an illusory duplicate.
Enemies starting their turn inside must make a Wis save or be disoriented (attack misses, random teleport, or 1d8 force damage).
Once per long rest (or expend a 5th-level slot to reuse).

entries.name: Reality Warp (3rd Level)
entries: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, choose a 10-ft cube within 30 ft to warp until start of your next turn:
• Enemies – treat as difficult terrain. • Allies – move at half cost and gain +1 AC.
You can maintain Int modifier zones for 1 minute; move them 10 ft as a Bonus Action. Regain uses after long rest.

entries.name: Unstable Field (6th Level)
entries: As a Bonus Action, create a 10-ft aura of chaotic energy for 1 minute. At the start of each turn, roll a d6 for the effect:

1 – Enemies take 1d6 fire or lightning damage. 2 – Allies heal 1d6. 3 – All creatures pushed 5 ft. 4 – You gain +1 AC. 5 – Allies gain +5 ft speed. 6 – Spells inside +1 attack and save DCs. Also negates invisibility and illusions inside. Uses = Proficiency bonus per long rest.

entries.name: Fractured Reality (10th Level)
entries: You can cast mirror image or blur at will as a Reaction when targeted by an attack (no slot).
Once per long rest, force a creature within 60 ft to reroll a d20 with advantage or disadvantage. Uses = Proficiency bonus per long rest.

entries.name: Reality Burst (14th Level)
entries: As a Bonus Action, unleash dimensional energy in a 20-ft radius for 1 minute. Hostiles treat area as difficult terrain; you can mark two stable squares that cannot be moved or teleported from.
Each turn when a creature attacks or casts a spell there, you can use Reaction to Deflect Reality (disadvantage) or Phase Flicker (teleport target 10 ft).
When the field ends, choose a creature that started its turn inside; it makes a Con save vs your DC or takes 4d10 force damage (half on success). Once per long rest.

entries.name: Starburst Bolt
entries: You hurl a sparkling bolt of starlight. Make a ranged spell attack; on a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage and glitters until the start of your next turn, granting advantage on the next attack roll against it.
Damage increases by 1d10 at 5th (2d10), 11th (3d10), and 17th (4d10) level.

entries.name: Mini-Morph
entries: Shrink or enlarge a Tiny nonmagical object (or willing Tiny creature) to half or double size. The object’s weight changes proportionally.
Creative uses—shrinking tools or keys—can help bypass obstacles.

entries.name: Spectral Broom
entries: Summon a ghostly broom that hovers near you, performing light chores (carry 5 lb, clean, deliver items within 30 ft).
As a distraction in combat, it can impose disadvantage on one creature’s next Perception check against you.

entries.name: Mop-Up Magic
entries: Instantly clean or rearrange a 10-ft cube: remove grime, organize objects, or patch minor scuffs.
Used repeatedly over 10 minutes, can fully clean a small room or outfit.

entries.name: Comical Confusion
entries: Twist a creature’s perception into slapstick chaos. Wis save or be befuddled; at each turn start, roll d4:
1–2 attacks nearest creature, 3 moves 15 ft randomly, 4 stands giggling. Save ends the effect.

entries.name: Polymorph Pop!
entries: Wis save or transform target into a Tiny toy or trinket of your choice (speed 0, AC 12 + Int mod, keeps HP but no actions).
If form takes ≥ 10 damage from one source, effect ends. Each turn the target repeats the save.
When it reverts, it takes 2d8 force damage.
Can’t affect creatures with CR > your level. At higher slots, threshold +5 and damage +1d8 per slot.

entries.name: Summon Koopa
entries: Conjure a Koopa ally within range; roll d8 for type (Green, Red, Blue, Yellow, Paratroopa, Hammer Bro, Magikoopa, or Golden).
Acts after your turn and obeys commands. Lose concentration → vanishes in smoke.
At higher levels: +1 Koopa per slot above 3rd.

entries.name: Hexstar Storm
entries: A 20-ft radius sphere erupts with five shining stars. Each creature of your choice Dex save; fail = 5d10 force damage, success half.
Then roll d6 for a lingering effect (light, terrain, orbiting star +2 AC, buffs or temp HP, etc.).

entries.name: Summon Koopa Squad
entries: Conjure 1d4 + 2 Koopas (roll d8 each for type). They act after your turn and obey commands.
At turn end, roll d6 for antics (+AC, extra damage, group attack, shield wall, healing, etc.).

entries.name: Grand Star Cataclysm
entries: A colossal star detonates in a 60-ft radius; Dex save → 20d6 force + 20d6 radiant (half on success).
Then roll d12 for lingering cosmic effects (zero-gravity, healing light, falling fragments, etc.).

entries.name: Rewrite Reality
components: M (a fragment of a shattered star)
entries: Rewrite a 30-ft radius area: restore structures, banish summons, reshape terrain, or reverse catastrophic effects (at DM discretion).
After casting, roll d8 for side effect (exhaustion, healing, advantage, beneficial aura, etc.).
